physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Orientation only to person, markedly reduced spontaneous speech, and difficulty following multi-step commands. Nonfatiguing frontal release signs and appendicular paratonia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive behavioral changes including mutism, bowel and bladder incontinence, hypertonia, myoclonic jerks, and gait abnormalities (small steps on a widened base) developed over years.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe diffuse atrophy with frontal predominance and severe frontal lobe white matter attenuation on CT.
